sections.heading: Cerulean City
sections.text: Cerulean City is a beautiful city with flowing water and blooming flowers. It is located between Route 4, Route 24, Route 9, and Route 5.

rows: The same as the traded Pokémon
In the backyard of the northwest house (hidden)
From an old man in the north-northwest house
Held by Zynx, a Jynx received through a trade
From the Team Rocket Grunt, after defeating him
From the Bike Shop owner, in exchange for a Bike Voucher

tableFacts: Jynx can be found in FireRed and LeafGreen.
Poliwhirl can be obtained through a trade and is found in the same location as the traded Pokémon.
Rare Candy is hidden in the backyard of the northwest house.
Powder Jar is given by an old man in the north-northwest house.
TM03 (Water Pulse) is awarded by Misty after defeating her.
Fame Checker is received from Blue after defeating him.
Fab Mail is held by Zynx, a Jynx received through a trade.
TM28 (Dig) is obtained from a Team Rocket Grunt after defeating him.
Bicycle is obtained from the Bike Shop owner in exchange for a Bike Voucher.

subsections.heading: Time for a Trade
subsections.text: Visit the house next to the Pokémon Center to find an old man who would like to trade Pokémon. He is willing to part with his Jynx in exchange for a Poliwhirl. Poliwhirl can only be found by using a high-level fishing rod.

subsections.heading: Gym Badges, Explained
subsections.text: The northwest house belongs to a man who offers to explain the effects of the eight Gym Badges. Half of them give a slight power boost to a respective stat, while the other half ensure a Pokémon's obedience during battle. The first five unlock the use of field moves.

rows: Increases Attack, Allows Flash in the field
Ensures obedience up to level 30, Allows Cut in the field
Increases Speed, Allows Fly in the field
Ensures obedience up to level 50, Allows Strength in the field
Increases Defense, Allows Surf in the field
Ensures obedience up to level 70, Allows Rock Smash in the field
Increases Special Attack and Special Defense, Allows Waterfall in the field

subsections.heading: Medicine Man
subsections.text: The north-northwest house belongs to an old man. When provided with the required amount of Berry Powder, he is able to concoct a variety of medicines. On your first visit, he gives out the Powder Jar, which stores any and all Berry Powder obtained from the Berry Crush minigame.

subsections.heading: Bike Shop
subsections.text: It would be great to get a Bicycle from the Bike Shop in the southwest part of town, but they cost a whopping $1,000,000! It is not possible to carry that much money, so it looks like you are stuck traveling on foot for now.

subsections.heading: Breaking, Entering
subsections.text: The house in the northeast is currently blocked off by a police officer. It seems that Team Rocket has broken into the home and stolen a valuable item from its residents. Nothing can be done to remedy this at the moment, so set your sights on the Gym instead.

subsections.heading: Cerulean Gym
subsections.text: The Cerulean Gym specializes in Water-type Pokémon. Water-type moves are super effective against Fire-, Ground-, and Rock-type Pokémon, while Water-type Pokémon are weak to Electric- and Grass-type moves.
tableFacts: Swimmer Luis uses a Horsea at level 16.
Swimmer Luis also has a Shellder at level 16.
Picnicker Diana uses a Goldeen at level 19.
Misty, the Gym Leader, has a Staryu at level 18 and a Starmie at level 21.

subsections.heading: Rival Battle 3
subsections.text: When you head toward Route 24, Blue appears and taunts you as usual before drawing you into another battle. He leads with his Pidgeotto, so start off with Electric- and Rock-type attacks. His Abra is a sitting duck as its only move does not deal any damage, making a good opportunity to earn experience for your lower-leveled Pokémon.

sections.heading: Route 24
sections.text: Route 24 stretches north from Cerulean City to Route 25. Most of the area is occupied by a river and the Nugget Bridge that crosses it.

subsections.heading: Nugget Bridge
subsections.text: There are five Trainers to be fought on the famous Nugget Bridge. When all five are defeated, a man at the bridge's north end will reward you with a Nugget, a bit of gold that can be sold for a high price.
tableFacts: Bug Catcher Cale uses a Caterpie at level 10.
Bug Catcher Cale also has a Weedle at level 10.
Bug Catcher Cale has a Metapod at level 10.
Bug Catcher Cale has a Kakuna at level 10.
Lass Ali uses a Pidgey at level 12.
Lass Ali also has an Oddish at level 12.

sections.heading: Route 25
sections.text: Route 25 leads eastward from Route 24. The path winds its way through a forest before it ends overlooking the sea.

subsections.heading: Sea Cottage
subsections.text: The Sea Cottage belongs to Bill, a famous Pokémon researcher. When you step inside, it seems like Bill must be away, until you speak to the Pokémon inside. His latest experiment has gone awry and combined his DNA with that of a Pokémon!

subsections.heading: An Unfortunate Turn
subsections.text: He needs your help, so once he has stepped into the machine, inspect his PC to activate a program to undo the change and return him to normal. As a token of gratitude, he gives you an S.S. Ticket, which grants access to the luxury cruise ship currently docked in Vermilion City to the south.

subsections.heading: Bill's Favorite Pokémon
subsections.text: Before leaving the cape, you can exit and re-enter the cottage and inspect Bill's PC to view some of his favorite Pokémon. This adds three new pages to your Pokédex.

sections.heading: Cerulean City
sections.text: Once you return to Cerulean City, the officer blocking the burgled house has stepped aside, allowing you to enter. Inside are obvious signs of a break-in, like muddy footprints and overturned planters.

subsections.heading: Justice, Served
subsections.text: There is even a large hole in the wall! Step out through the hole to find and confront the thief.
tableFacts: The Team Rocket Grunt uses a Machop at level 17.
The Team Rocket Grunt also has a Drowzee at level 17.

sections.heading: Route 5
sections.text: Route 5 is a scenic road that runs downhill from Cerulean City to Saffron City. The first of the region's two Underground Paths begins here and runs southward underneath Saffron City to re-emerge on Route 6.

subsections.heading: Available Pokémon
tableFacts: Pidgey can be found at levels 13, 15-16 with a 40% encounter rate.
Meowth can be found at levels 10, 12, 14, 16 with a 35% encounter rate.
Oddish can be found at levels 12-14 with a 25% encounter rate.
Bellsprout can be found at levels 12-14 with a 25% encounter rate.

subsections.heading: Pokémon Day Care
subsections.text: The house on the hill is the Pokémon Day Care. The old man inside will raise one Pokémon at a time while you are away.

subsections.heading: Underground Path
subsections.text: It is impossible to reach Saffron City at the moment, so enter the Underground Path and follow the tunnel to Route 6.
